TEXT: CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company entered into a purchase agreement with Královéhradecká brokerská a.s . , a joint stock company incorporated under NORP law ( “ KHB ” ) . Under the agreement it bought CARDINAL book - entry shares representing PERCENT of the registered capital of QUANTITY . , a joint stock company incorporated under NORP law . CARDINAL . Under Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(a ) an individual alleging an impairment of his or her rights guaranteed by constitutional law may lodge a constitutional appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . Until DATE , LAW read as follows :
“ Controllable natural resources , too , shall be regarded as items . ”
CARDINAL . Another sentence was inserted into that provision on DATE . It provided as follows :
“ The provisions governing items shall also apply to securities . ”
CARDINAL . After Act no . PERSON entered into force on DATE , this provision became LAW .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL governs the obligation to hand over items of importance for criminal proceedings . Under paragraph CARDINAL , persons possessing such items are required to submit them to a court , prosecutor or police authority at the latter ’s request . If the item is being seized for the purposes of the criminal proceedings , the person concerned must surrender it to the prosecuting authorities at their request .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , if the person concerned does not surrender the item of importance for the criminal proceedings , it must be taken from him / her and seized on an order from the president of a chamber during the trial or by the prosecutor , investigator or police authority at the pre - trial stage of the proceedings . The investigator or police authority may do so only with the authorisation of a prosecutor .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that items which are no longer needed for the criminal proceedings and whose confiscation or seizure can be ruled out should be returned to the person concerned . Under LAW § CARDINAL a decision on this matter at the pre - trial stage of the criminal proceedings is adopted by a prosecutor . Such a decision may be challenged by means of a complaint .
CARDINAL . According to LAW rulings of prosecutor , investigator and police have the form of decision .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL states that a complaint is a remedy against a decision .
CARDINAL . Under LAW a first - instance decision adopted by a court or a prosecutor may be challenged by means of a complaint only where the law explicitly so provides .

CARDINAL . Article DATE provides for the seizure of financial assets deposited in a bank account . Under paragraph CARDINAL , if the facts indicate that the financial assets in a bank account are destined for the commission of a crime , or have already been used for such purposes , or constitute the proceeds of criminal activities , the president of a chamber or a prosecutor , or the police authority at the pre - trial stage of the criminal proceedings , are empowered to impound them . Paragraph CARDINAL provides that such seizure may be challenged by means of a complaint .

CARDINAL . The newly introduced Article CARDINALc governs the seizure of book - entry shares . Under paragraph CARDINAL , should the president of the chamber , or the prosecutor at the pre - trial stage of the criminal proceedings , decide on a seizure of book - entry shares , ORG , a legal person empowered to keep records and exercise other activities of ORG under a specific law , or ORG must open a special bank account in which the seized securities are deposited . Paragraph CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the authorities mentioned in paragraph CARDINAL may suspend the rights connected with seized shares . According to paragraph CARDINAL , Article CARDINAL applies mutatis mutandis to the procedure governing decisions to seize book - entry shares and to reduce the terms of or lift such seizures .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINALa , which provided for a review by a court of seizures of property by a prosecutor , was substantially amended , bringing within its ambit , inter alia , decisions on seizures of book - entry shares under LAW , financial assets , real estate and other assets . However , seizures of items under LAW do not fall within its scope .
CARDINAL . Section DATE ( CARDINAL ) provides that a decision adopted by a prosecutor may be reviewed by a superior prosecutor unless the LAW or another law provides otherwise .
CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) a share certificate may be substituted by a bookentry share , that is , by entry in a record of shares as provided for by law .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided for suspension of the right to dispose of bookentry shares . Under paragraph CARDINAL , a suspension order was to be issued by the competent ORG authority , under a specific law ( for instance , section CARDINAL of LAW ) . The provision was repealed by Act no . CARDINAL , which entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides for suspension of the owner ’s disposal rights over book - entry investment instruments . Under paragraph CARDINAL(b ) , an order registering the suspension of the owner ’s disposal rights is granted by the competent court or administrative authority , if it is necessary in connection with the issuing of a preliminary measure , for the purposes of judicial or administrative proceedings , or if a specific law so provides .
